savingProgressTitle.modalTitle: Translations are being generated and saved. Please wait.

additionalFormFields.treatDeliveryAsItemHelpText: If you activate this setting, treat the delivery costs in the table as an order item. Then, the additional shipping cost line in the table will be taken into account when setting page breaks (see 'Items per page' option).
additionalFormFields.treatDeliveryAsItemLabel: Treat delivery costs as order item

settingReplacedMessage.displayHeader: Please use the PDF Template Editor to remove or add the header

settingReplacedMessage.displayPageCount: Please use the PDF Template Editor to remove or add page numbering
settingReplacedMessage.displayPrices: Please use the PDF Template Editor to remove or add prices
settingReplacedMessage.itemsPerPage: Please use the PDF Template Editor to set the number of items per page. You will find the setting in the left column of the editor when you open the preview.

activationPanel.errorRefreshMessage: Please reload this page as soon as you have corrected the cause of the error.

invoice-already-paid-online.name:
Already paid online
(PayPal, Credit card, etc.)

components.customPresetSuccessfullyImported: Your element has been successfully saved
components.document-fanning-auto-tooltip: Document will fan out when you hover over it or want to place an element. Fanning out makes it easier to select the right element.
components.label: New Element
components.title: New Element

defaultStyles.embeddedGoogleFontsDescription:
Visit Google Fonts to choose your desired fonts and then specify them here.

Important: Please list the name of your desired Google Fonts in the font lists of the 'Font' field comma-separated.
defaultStyles.globalCssDescription:
You can either use the Custom CSS Classes that you can add to each element under 'Configure Element' > 'CSS' > 'Add Custom CSS Class' > 'CSS Class', or use the following default classes:

  • Document Body: mj-body
  • Section: mj-section
  • Column: mj-column
  • Image: mj-image
  • Text: mj-text
  • Spacer: mj-spacer
defaultStyles.label: Document Styles
defaultStyles.title: Document Styles

importExport.info:
Would you like to save your document template and reuse it in another document type?

Simply save your template to a file and import it into another document.

Pro Tip: With this feature, you can also transfer templates between different shop instances, such as production, dev, or staging systems.
importExport.label: Import Export
importExport.title: Import or Export Template

preview.fakeOrderDescription: Once you have captured an order in your shop, you can use it to generate preview PDFs. Until then, sample data will be used.

itemsPerPage.description:
Please test your design with an order that has so few items that only one page is needed and test again with an order that has so many items that at least 3 pages are needed. Then, please enter the number of items in the fields below that fit on the respective pages.

This is important so that Shopware sets the page breaks correctly and there are no overlaps with the footer.
itemsPerPage.title: Number of Items per Page

preview.label: Preview
preview.pleaseLeaveRatingText:
Please leave us a starstarstarstarstar rating.
We highly appreciate your support!
preview.pleaseLeaveRatingTitle: Do you like the PDF Template Editor?
preview.title: Preview Settings

code.description:
Your Twig code will be executed before the current element is output. Conditions and loops for repeating the element will be executed after this code. Please use curly braces to write correct Twig syntax.

You can use this code to initialize new variables that will be available in text elements within this element.

Example:
{% set currencyIsoCode = order.currency.isoCode %}
code.title: Code

condition.description:
Enter Twig code here that returns true or false.
Please do not use curly braces

Example:
billingAddress.company is not empty
condition.title: Condition

css.globalCssDescription: You can assign an additional CSS class to the element, which you will then use under 'Document Styles' > 'Global CSS' to style the element.

info-box.description:
If a CSS style has already been set through a setting in the 'Style' tab, you must mark your CSS style with '!important' to override the setting.

Example:
/* Overwrite setting of the Style-tab */
font-weight: 300 !important;

/* Add other styles */
position: relative;
top: 5px;
left: 5px;

css.title: CSS

repeat.description:
Your configured 'Iterated Variable' and 'Variable Name within Loop' will be converted into a for loop that encloses the current element.

Your 'Variable Name within Loop' will be available as a variable in text elements.

Example value for 'Iterated Variable'
order.lineItems
Example value for 'Variable Name within Loop'
lineItem
Example Result
{% for lineItem in order.lineItems %}
    ...
{% endfor %}
repeat.title: Repeat per Item in Variable

styles.backgroundImageHint:
Please use the following dimensions for your background image and compress it before uploading to tinypng.com':
A4 Portrait: 793px × 1122px
A4 Landscape: 1122px × 793px
styles.title: Styles

visibility.description:
Depending on the document setting 'Items per page' and the number of items in the order, your PDF may span multiple pages.

All elements are visible on every page by default. Elements such as the logo, order items, and footer should be displayed on every page. Elements such as the billing and shipping address should only be displayed on the first page.

Therefore, you have the option here to specify which rows should be visible only on the First, Last, or on every page.
visibility.title: Visibility
